Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one representing land and the other representing water, but may omit some details or features unique to each.
The student can include some different types of plants and animals in each habitat, like trees in the land habitat and fish in the water habitat, but may not be comprehensive in their selection.
The student can show basic organization of plants and animals within each habitat but may not clearly demonstrate specific ecological niches.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to comprehensively show diverse types of plants and animals in each habitat or may mix habitats (e.g., placing aquatic animals in a land habitat).
The student may struggle to make accurate comparisons through their drawings and may not effectively show differences in the types of living things present in each habitat.

The student cannot clearly explain how their observations depict patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats, often lacking labeled elements or annotations to convey this understanding.
